item.title: Family Visits Singapura
item.description: My parents and in-laws traveled to SG last September and it was truly memorable! I’m trying out some code to display a Google Photos album and it’s quite cool that I’m able to embed the album here.

item.title: Making the OFW leap
item.description: Over a year ago, a friend invited me to take on a job in Singapore. Whenever I get asked about working overseas, I’d say I’d give it some thought.

item.title: Google Apps Certified Deployment Specialist
item.description: Back in November last year, the Apps Services Partner that I help with Google Apps Support told me that I was required to take the Google Apps for Work Deployment Specialist certification exam.

item.title: On Planning and Reports
item.description: In my previous employment, I didn’t have any problems with submitting reports, practically because we used a time management/monitoring tool and the reports sort of generated by themselves.

item.title: Moving Forward
item.description: In a month’s time, I would be transferring offices again. I started from a very technical department, under the administration cluster.

item.title: Engineering, I.T., Business Management, and Technopreneurship
item.description: By 2016, five higher education institutes (HEIs) here in the Philippines will be integrating Technopreneurship as an offered elective for their Engineering programs.

item.title: Apple Announces MacBook Pro Repair Extension Program for Video Issues
item.description: I didn’t think there was going to be any hope for my early 2011 MacBook Pro, which had GPU-related problems after only about a year of use.

item.title: Got Static!
item.description: I just made the first step towards moving my whole blog to GitHub and going all static! Content is generated by Pelican, a static site generator, written in Python.

item.title: Racking Legacy Servers - Part 1
item.description: Earlier today we scheduled the racking of our old C-Class HP BladeSystem. It used to be wrapped in its own enclosure with wheels to boot, but it didn’t make sense to have it stand outside the cabinets.

item.title: A better Monday than most
item.description: The day’s just begun and I’m already up to my neck with work. But I’m not complaining. At least it’s server stuff and not some other crap!

item.title: Work over Christmas Break 2014
item.description: 10 years ago, I wouldn’t be complaining at all. I could live in a datacenter for days until the job’s done.

item.title: It's no longer about the number of monitors you have
item.description: Unlike in the late 90s to mid 2000s, desktop real estate is no longer constrained by the number of monitors you use.

item.title: Crystal Reports Redux
item.description: I didn’t think I’d be saying this many years down the road, but here goes anyway. Crystal Reports is my friend.

item.title: GBG Cagayan de Oro Turns One
item.description: We had our 1st anniversary last week as a Google Business Group community. We look forward to doing more for Cagayan de Oro and the surrounding municipalities this year!

item.title: Our daughter's happy 13th
item.description: Our daughter asked to celebrate her birthday a day ahead, with her 8th grade classmates. They had water gun and balloon fights, and bags of holi powder to throw around.

item.title: Sign up for the first MapUp this 2014!
item.description: This is our opening salvo for the year. Since we started last year, GBG Cagayan de Oro has been receiving a lot of good feedback from the locals.

item.title: MySQL on Google Cloud Infrastructure Now Available
Christmas 2013
item.description: We decided to go to Cebu and spend Christmas this year with my parents and brother. I suppose it has been more than 15 years since we last celebrated Christmas together.

item.title: Community work, with Google.
item.description: Community work, with Google. Thank you mentors +Aileen Apolo +Chelle Gray +Vince Tabor and +Mohd Hadi Shafie Awang Othman! Thank you to my counterparts +Jerome Locson +Johnn Mendoza +Katherine Yap +Dulce Rose Lada +Rosario Juan +Juned Sonido and +Avel Manansala for inspiring me to do more for the community.

item.title: Just yesterday, August 7, we had our first academe-focused event, which we called "Enhancing Research...
item.description: Just yesterday, August 7, we had our first academe-focused event, which we called “Enhancing Research with Google Technologies”. We partnered with the Kinaadman Research Center (KRC) and through the auspices of Dr.

item.title: Last July 20, we had our Diversity and Inclusion event for women, which we called "Empowering Women ...
item.description: Last July 20, we had our Diversity and Inclusion event for women, which we called “Empowering Women on the Go”. We worked with a local JCI chapter, JCI Bai Lawanen, and their members were able to listen to Harriet Fernandez, a director for an IT unit at Xavier University, and Shayryl Mae Ramos, a learning management system administrator, also at Xavier University.

item.title: Valentine Surprise
item.description: Each year, on Valentine’s day, I usually surprise my darling wife with a letter/card, or a bouquet of roses. As it was a yearly thing, I knew she sort of expected these surprises; she’d look surprised, but I knew she wasn’t really.

item.title: on SLMIS
item.description: End users complain because the system isn’t “user-friendly”. FYI, it’s meant to be that way. It’s the only way we can guarantee that the system will still be helpful 25 years from now.

item.description: Miguel got real bored at home and wanted to go and meet his classmates. Since school doesn’t start until the 7th, I decided to take him with me to the office.

item.description: I sort of miss being in the backseat. A lot of my goofing off years have been conducted within the confines of the passenger doors, backside of the front seats, and the backseat.

item.title: Revisited: Blog changes, etc.
item.description: I’ve once more moved my blog. This time, it’s on my own hosting account and it’s back to using WP. Same blog, different flavor now and moving forward.

item.title: Honor God, Make Disciples
item.description: A couple of months ago, I started attending this workshop/training for leaders at Victory CDO. It’s called Training for Victory (T4V), and it was a once-a-week engagement for about 10 weeks; although it took longer than that because of several holidays around that time.

item.title: Thank you!

item.title: Thank you!
item.description: I am home, and enjoying my second lease in life, one slow day at a time. I have never been hospitalized for something as life-threatening as DHF with complications before, so it’s a bit frustrating that even when I’m already out of the hospital, I could not move around as much as I want.

item.title: Miguel, lately.
item.description: Since we moved apartments, the little man started doing facial expressions that always gets us wondering how he got them. I’ve tried capturing these expressions with a camera but it’s a lot harder than simply having the phone or the point-and-shoot handy at all times.

item.title: Covered area expansion project
item.description: We’ve recently decided to cover the whole area where the outdoor canteen was and turn into an activity area. item.description: just how much water can your body take? doing a little experiment while i’m on treatment. one freakin’ mug-full an hour.

item.title: you're looking good, opensource!
item.description: opensource gets another breakthrough today, as canonical launches launchpad personal package archive (PPA), an ubuntu linux developers service intended to extend collaboration in software development and give the community equal opportunity to build and package code for ubuntu on the desktop, server, and for mobile applications.

item.title: on work and blogging
item.description: i haven’t been updating for several important, albeit lousy reasons. work has been keeping me up at nights and i feel that if i were to write entries, i wouldn’t be making much sense.

item.description: i’ve had this happen to me again the other week and as always, felt like kicking myself for not remembering.

item.description: I recently got Ubuntu Feisty Fawn Beta running on my HP Pavilion dv2001tu notebook, and I’m very happy with the way it’s running.

item.title: LJ rocks more than ever

item.title: Shelving trigger.cdo.linux.org.ph
item.description: I am officially bringing down my old tech blog after Holy Week. It has virtually become a sinkhole for all kinds of spam links and I have barely done anything to keep it up-to-date.

item.title: The rush that's called Graduation
item.description: I sometimes wish it were me. But I’d rather have my daughter bask in her moment. It’s just that I clearly remember the feeling.

item.description: I sometimes wish it were me. But I’d rather have my daughter bask in her moment. It’s just that I clearly remember the feeling.

item.description: Forget the housemates! Mariel Rodriguez makes this reality TV show “watchable”. Half past midnight since the new season launched and the server is already borked!

item.title: IP-hijacking and then some
item.description: Almost a month of downtime. The servers were fine, but our IP addresses were not. Somehow, a system bug from one of the hosting companies caused our plan to include 14 other IP addresses, and we only maintained 6 as far as I am concerned.

item.title: Using symbolic links for MySQL data files
item.description: Over a year ago, we had several servers configured for high traffic websites. A mispartioning resulted in /var becoming obscenely small, and it was only after MySQL crashed that we remembered this.

item.title: Leeching for internet access
item.description: Sure, my bosses do this all the time…in airports, hotel lobbies, and coffee shops. The mere act of “connecting” to an unsecured wireless network doubles as a necessity and as a leaching of sorts.

item.title: Leeching for internet access
item.description: Sure, my bosses do this all the time…in airports, hotel lobbies, and coffee shops. The mere act of “connecting” to an unsecured wireless network doubles as a necessity and as a leaching of sorts.

item.title: What it means to aggregate thinking
item.description: I love thinking. They say thinking burns as many calories as when you’re having sex…so you may liken thinking to sex.

item.description: Casey Kasem’s American Top 40 broadcast back in April 1988 is being streamed today over XM Radio. Def Leppard’s Hysteria is currently playing.

item.title: Remote posting to Blogger Beta
item.description: There’s a pretty slick Windows application that will allow you to post directly to your Blogger Beta account. The Firefox extension Deepest Sender, which allows posting to LJ, Blogger, and Wordpress, doesn’t work with Blogger Beta yet, so here’s a workaround that you can do meantime.

item.description: Okay, it has been around for quite some time, and I remember writing an article about this in my older tech blog.

item.description: I absolutely love Gaim, but the message to group feature isn’t readily available, even with gaim2-beta3, and this doesn’t work for me especially that I sometimes need to broadcast messages to team members over IM.

item.description: Over the Holy Week, two of our home computer’s drives crashed, probably due to extensive user download, software installs, and malware.

item.description: I had the opportunity to spend a few days vacationing in Manila. My mom-in-law was attending a national conference for pediatricians, and was given travel sponsorships for the entire family.

item.title: Plug: I'm selling a Nokia 3200
item.description: If anyone’s interested, we’re selling a Nokia 3200. It has great features for an entry imaging-recording level gadget, plus more. I especially like the cover template cutter.

item.description: If I pointed you to another blog of mine, would you visit that as much, considering that it would have mostly techno babble in it, and that it won’t have the indispensable “my friends” link (because it’s not on LJ)?

item.title: first week school blues
item.description: I got really dissed last night waiting for instructors to report for class. It almost seemed prank-like to me, because we were all waiting for this guy to show up, and just a few minutes before we were afforded a free cut, somebody got SMS from the instructor, apologizing that he wasn’t going to make it (again).

item.title: go San Antonio Spurs!
item.description: Robert Horry’s the man!!! What a clincher for a do-or-die game 5 for the Spurs! Horry’s 3 pointer shots saved his team twice, once to secure an OT, and the second to give them a 1-shot victory over the Pistons!

item.title: dumbass mode
item.description: i’m really hoping my old server gets up soon so i can download my shit out and start publishing again from our own servers here.

item.title: getting back on track
item.description: I’m back at work. My recent sickness made me think again about my eating habits, my vices, and how I love shunning medication and prescriptions; preferring proper rest and vigorous exercise over anything pharmaceutically made.
